metadata.chief_complaint: headaches x1 week, needs glasses Rx, optho referral, follow up

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi Emma, hi Mom. Headaches for the past week?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, she's been complaining almost every day after school. Sometimes she says the words on the board are blurry too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Emma, where does your head hurt?

script.speaker: child
script.text: In the front, like above my eyes.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Both sides or one side?

script.speaker: child
script.text: Both.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Does light bother your eyes when your head hurts?

script.speaker: child
script.text: A little bit.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Any nausea or vomiting with the headaches?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: No, nothing like that.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: When did she last have her eyes checked?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Um, probably two years ago? At school they said her vision was fine.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let me do a quick vision check.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Emma, read the smallest line you can on that chart.

script.speaker: child
script.text: E, F, P... um... I can't see the rest.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Okay. She's reading about 20/50 in both eyes. That's enough to cause eye strain headaches, especially with close work and screen time.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: So she needs glasses?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Very likely. I'm going to refer her to an optometrist, Dr. Williams, for a full eye exam and glasses prescription. I think once we correct her vision, the headaches will improve significantly.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay. Is there anything else causing the headaches?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let me do a quick neuro exam to be safe.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Follow my finger with your eyes. Good. Squeeze my hands. Push against me. Smile, raise your eyebrows. Everything looks normal neurologically.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: That's a relief.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: In the meantime, while you wait for the eye appointment, she can take ibuprofen for the headaches. Also make sure she takes breaks from screens every 20 minutes.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: How long should we wait to see if the glasses help?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let's have her come back in four weeks. If she's still having headaches after she has glasses, we'll dig deeper. But I'm optimistic this is vision-related.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Sounds good. So the plan is eye doctor referral, ibuprofen as needed, and follow up in four weeks?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Exactly right. I'll put in the referral to Dr. Williams and schedule your follow up before you leave.

script.speaker: child
script.text: Do I get to pick my glasses?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: You sure do. That's the fun part.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Thank you, Doctor.
